results.title: How Students in 12 Countries Are Taught About 9/11
results.abstract: Twelve teenagers born after 9/11 told us what they have learned about the event and its aftermath — and what has been left out.
results.byline: By Damien Cave and Yousur Al-Hlou

results.title: Lebanon Gets New Prime Minister Amid Economic Meltdown
results.abstract: The billionaire Najib Mikati’s new cabinet is Lebanon’s first empowered government in more than a year. It faces the immediate challenge of a collapsing economy.

multimedia.caption: Lebanon’s prime minister, Najib Mikati, arriving to the presidential palace in Baabda, near Beirut, on Friday.

results.title: The ‘Plagiarism Hunter’ Terrorizing the German-Speaking World
results.abstract: Stefan Weber has ended careers, forced politicians from office, hounded scores of others and even created a thriving business in his quest to end literary theft.

multimedia.caption: Stefan Weber, an Austrian communications professor and self-appointed plagiarist hunter, at Mooncity, a museum in Salzburg. His latest prominent target is Annalena Baerbock, the German candidate for chancellor from the Green Party.
multimedia.copyright: Laetitia Vancon for The New York Times

results.title: Biden Speaks With Xi Amid Low Point in U.S.-China Relations
results.abstract: The call was only the second time the leaders had spoken since President Biden’s inauguration. The lack of communication was a measure of the rising tensions between the two countries.

results.title: France to Offer Free Contraception for Women Up to 25
results.abstract: The government, responding to what it said was a decline in the use of contraceptives among some young women because of the cost, will pay for contraception starting next year.
results.byline: By Isabella Kwai and Léontine Gallois

multimedia.caption: The government said it would set aside about 21 million euros, or about $25 million, to pay for contraceptives and consultations on their use.

results.title: Covid has disrupted learning for more than 400 million children in South Asia, the U.N. says.
results.abstract: A UNICEF report warned that the pandemic had forced a premature transition to remote learning in a region where many lack reliable internet access.

multimedia.caption: The first day of partial reopening of schools in Noida, a suburb of New Delhi, last week.
The first day of partial reopening of schools in Noida, a suburb of New Delhi, last week.

results.title: ‘Football Is Like Food’: Afghan Female Soccer Players Find a Home in Italy
results.abstract: Members of a team from Herat left behind the lives they had built in Afghanistan in hopes that they can build a future where they can play, and thrive.

multimedia.caption: Members of the Herat soccer team at a camp run by the Italian Red Cross in Avezzano, Italy, last week.
multimedia.copyright: Fabio Bucciarelli for The New York Times
